entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY ENDED, Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 03:51 AM NST Friday 27 January 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Light Rain, 2.3°C
entry.summary:

entry.title: Thursday night: A few showers or drizzle. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning.
entry.summary: Showers or periods of drizzle. Wind south 50 km/h gusting to 70. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning. Forecast issued 04:02 AM NST Friday 27 January 2023

entry.title: Friday: Chance of flurries or rain showers. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon. POP 40%
entry.summary: A few rain showers or flurries ending in the morning then mainly cloudy with 40 percent chance of flurries. Wind southwest 50 km/h gusting to 70 becoming west 30 gusting to 50 in the afternoon. Temperature falling to minus 6 in the afternoon. Wind chill minus 16 in the afternoon. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 04:02 AM NST Friday 27 January 2023

entry.title: Friday night: Clearing. Low minus 20.
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. Clearing overnight. Wind west 20 km/h gusting to 40. Low minus 20. Wind chill minus 15 in the evening and minus 29 overnight. Risk of frostbite. Forecast issued 04:02 AM NST Friday 27 January 2023
